result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order /s/ 11/01/22
Defendant Record Update
Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:56 AM Defendant Jarrod W. Coyle in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for Jarrod W. Coyle.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard:  22CF104, 22CF399 & 20CT42.

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.
ADA Dodge states that they will set this for a Jury Trial.
Atty Lockery states a Preliminary Hearing needs to be completed on 22CF399.
ADA Dodge states that the only case for a Jury Trial will be 22CF104.
Defendant would like to have this set for a contested Preliminary Hearing.
Court would like this to be set with Judge Flugaur.  Court questions Atty Lockery and his client if that would be an issue.
Defendant would not like to have this heard by Judge Flugaur.

BY THE COURT: 
Preliminary Hearing on December 21, 2022 @ 8:30 a.m. for 22CF399.
22CF104 & 20CT42 to be set for status conference on this date to track with 22CF399 

Court questions how many days.
ADA Dodge would ask for 2 days.
Atty Lockery is in agreement with the 2 days.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation; no victims appear at today's hearing.

BY THE COURT: 
12 Person Jury Trial:   January 11 - 12, 2023 
Final PreTrial:  December 16, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m.  
Discovery has been exchanged by November 11, 2022 
Substantive Motions filed by November 18, 2022 
Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions & Witness Lists filed by December 2, 2022
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 11, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Jarrod W. Coyle not in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery not in court.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Both files heard: 20CT42, 22CF104

Atty Dodge has spoken with Atty Lockery.  The defendant has a new case with an initial appearance on October 3.  Asks to adjourn the scheduling conference and set for a pre-trial conference. 
Court reviews the file.  
Court orders that these cases be set for another scheduling conference and asks the state to provide an offer rather quickly.  

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 3 Judge on 03/28/22 sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant does not waive reading of information. 
3:46 p.m. ADA Dodge reads the information.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:38 PM Defendant Jarrod W. Coyle in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Jarrod W. Coyle.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

3:38 p.m.  Officer J Anderson is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Dodge.
3:39 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Dodge would ask that the court take judicial notice of 12CF116.

BY THE COURT: 
Court takes judicial notice.

3:43 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Renc.
ADA Dodge has no redirect.
3:44 p.m.  Witness is excused.
ADA Dodge has no further witnesses.
Atty Renc has no witnesses.
ADA Dodge gives his final argument.
Atty Renc reserves her right for bind over.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Initial Appearance set for March 7, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1
Successful Fax Notification
Do not possess any firearms.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Felon in Possession of Firearm, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $800 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments to the court and requests a signature bond for the reasons stated. 
Defendant makes statements that the weapon was in a locked secure box.  

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  3/07/2022  @  1:15 p.m.  in Branch 2

Defendant makes additional statements to the court. 
Atty Bergner makes statements to the defendant. 
Court advises the defendant to take that up with his attorney. 
Defendant continues to make additional statements.
